intro: Colymbada psilacantha, commonly known as the slender leaved colymbada, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in a compact cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
